name: clmsubrg
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: simp3bi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)), wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c2, co(ccnfld, cress, c1)))
stmt.pretty: simp3bi(c0 ∈ CMod, c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld), c0 ∈ LMod, c2 =(CCfld[|`s]c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c2, co(ccnfld, cress, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c2 =(CCfld[|`s]c1)∧ c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c2, co(ccnfld, cress, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c2 =(CCfld[|`s]c1)∧ c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c2, co(ccnfld, cress, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c2 =(CCfld[|`s]c1)∧ c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))
⊣ c2 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))
⊣ c2 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c2)

comment: The base set of the ring of scalars of a subcomplex module is the base set of a subring of the field of complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
